citeinfo.title: Data release: Exploring the exceptional performance of a deep learning stream temperature model and the value of streamflow data (Provisional Data Release)
citeinfo.geoform: Landing page and parent metadata for the full data release

citeinfo.title: Exploring the exceptional performance of a deep learning stream temperature model and the value of streamflow data.

descript.abstract:
This data release provides all data and code used in Rahmani et al. (2020) to model stream temperature and assess results. Briefly, we used the USGS Gages II dataset as a test case for temperature prediction using deep learning methods. The associated manuscript explores the value of including stream discharge as a predictor in the temperature models, including the value of predicted discharge from a separate model when no discharge measurements are available.

The data are organized into these items:

  1. Spatial Information - Outlet locations for the 118 river basins used in this study
  2. Observations - Water temperature observations for the 118 river basin pour points used in this study
  3. Model Inputs - Model inputs, including basin attributes, weather drivers, and discharge
  4. Models - Code and configurations for the stream temperature models
  5. Model Predictions - Predictions of stream water temperature
  6. Model Evaluation - Performance metrics for each stream temperature model

This research was funded by the Integrated Water Prediction Program at the US Geological Survey.
descript.purpose: Decision support, water quality research, and advancement of machine learning in hydrology

spdom.descgeog: Locations of sites used in the study, which are a subset of the Gages II dataset.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
